title: Apollo 8 was the first mission to orbit the Moon

images.description: Anders being briefed by MSC Landing and Recovery Division Chief Jerome Hammack during water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico
The crew of Apollo 8 participates in recovery training aboard the retriever.
(description not yet available)
Apollo 8 astronauts Frank Borman and William Anders relax aboard the NASA Motor Vessel Retriever after suiting up for water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico
Apollo 8 backup astronaut Fred W. Haise, Jr. prepares for water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico
Astronaut James Lovell is hoisted up to US Coast Guard helicopter during water egress training in Gulf of Mexico
Apollo 8 crew in boilerplate 1102A for water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico
Apollo 8 crew in boilerplate 1102A for water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico
The crew of Apollo 8
Apollo 8 crew inside the gondola during centrifuge training in MSC s Flight Acceleration Facility in Building 29
Prime crew for Apollo 8 (l-r) Frank Borman, William A. Anders, and James A. Lovell, Jr.
Apollo 8 astronauts (l-r) William A. Anders, James a. Lovell and Frank Borman are shown inside the Apollo mission simulator at KSC
Alternate portrait of Apollo 8 astronauts (l-r) James Lovell, command module pilot; William Anders, lunar module pilot; and Frank Borman, commander
Apollo commander Frank Borman poses with his wife, Susan, and sons, Frederick (l) and Edwin.
Apollo 8 Command Module Pilot James Lovell poses with his wife, Marilyn, and children, James and Barbara, standing on stairs, and Susan and Jeffrey, below.
Apollo 8 Lunar Module Pilot William Anders poses with his wife, Valerie, and children, clockwise from top next to Astronaut Anders:  Greg, Alan, Gayle & Eric.
Apollo 8 crew in CM during training
Astronauts Edwin E. Aldrin, Jr., command module pilot, and Neil A. Armstrong, commander of the backup crew for Apollo 8, suiting up for emergency egress tests at LC-39A

The backup crew for Apollo 8, astronauts Neil Armstrong, commander, Edwin E. Aldrin, Jr., command module pilot and Fred W. Haise, Jr., lunar module pilot, are suited up for emergency egress tests at launch Complex 39-A
Astronaut Fred W. Haise, Jr., the lunar module pilot backup crew member for Apollo 8, suiting up for emergency egress tests at LC-39A
